alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued January 05 at 3:31AM MST until January 05 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility less than 1 mile at times to 4 miles in freezing fog. The fog is patchy so visibility may change dramatically over short distances. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area, Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, Upper Rio Grande Valley, Espanola Valley, and Santa Fe Metro Area. * WHEN...Until 9 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous. A light glaze may develop on frozen surfaces.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley
